channel.title: Don't know where this should go | | Need help making a program
channel.description:
I'm trying to make a program that when you type in something like this "class8.aStringArray189 = " it automatically changes it to this "itemDef.actions =" (class8 to itemDef converting). I have all the lists of conversions with me right here. [code]class8.aStringArray189 = => itemDef.actions = class8.aStringArray189[1] = => itemDef.actions[1] = class8.anInt190 = => itemDef.modelRotation1 = class8.anInt198 = => itemDef.modelRotation2 = class8.anInt181 = => itemDef.modelZoom = class8.anInt169 = => itemDef.modelOffset1 = class8.aByteArray178 = => itemDef.description = class8.aString170 = => itemDef.name = class8.aBoolean176 = => itemDef.stackable = class8.anInt165 = => itemDef.maleEquip1 = class8.anInt200 = => itemDef.femaleEquip1 = class8.anInt204 = => itemDef.anInt204 = class8.anInt175 = => itemDef.anInt175 = class8.anInt197 = => itemDef.anInt197 = class8.anIntArray156 = => itemDef.originalModelColors = class8.anIntArray160 = => itemDef.modifiedModelColors = class8.anInt164 = => itemDef.maleEquip2 = class8.anInt188 = => itemDef.femaleEquip2 = class8.anInt194 = => itemDef.modelOffset2 = class8.anInt174 = => itemDef.modelID =[/code]
Skype me @ ian.lehrer (: thanks

item.source: Don't know where this should go | | Need help making a program

item.title: Don't know where this should go | | Need help making a program
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

Here’s how I’d approach the matter.

GUI with two text areas.
One side being non renamed text.
One being renamed text.
Two small buttons in the middle for conversions between (non to renamed) and(renamed to non

Upon clicking either button, take the text area, check for text and clear the other text area. Then split the text area by line. \n
Check to see if each line contains each non/renamed variable
If so, append the alternative variable name in the alternative text area.

[quote=“IanLehrer, post:5, topic:527455”]takes to long too manually do it for 100’s of different items.[/quote]find and replace can do “replace all” in many modern text editors.
Also there are tools that already convert what you’re trying to do. But if you want the “learning experience” go for it

Read full topic

item.description:

item.source: Don't know where this should go | | Need help making a program

item.title: Don't know where this should go | | Need help making a program
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Just use a buffered reader or a scanner and a switch statement that checks each type and writes the output to a new file, as long as the file you’re feeding it is laid out correctly, you should have no problems.

Read full topic
